Fields.DialogueText: Hm... A little bit more to the right, Marcus, if you'd please.
You got it! ... All righty, there. How's that?
Uff da. Now that's a real beauty. Good work, Marcus! (*Pat-pat!*)
It ain't nothing! Hm? What's that you got there, Eliezer?
Oh this? Just came in from stateside. Cousin sent me an early present from his factory job. I don't celebrate the damn holiday, but he and I always send each other gifts.
You gonna wait till Christmas?
He told me to open it right away because he said, "You all are going to love this." Whatever the hell he wants to say about it... All right, let's see here... (*Rip!*)
Eh!? Eliezer! That's a train set! Oh, that'll be perfect under the tree!
Aw, man! I haven't seen one of these since my days back in Sheboygan. All right, I'm gonna go set this up. Who wants to do the decorating around it?
Shit, I'll call Feng. He loves that kind of stuff. We got time to kill! Let's roll!
Man-oh-man. I ought to send my brother a thank you card with a bottle of wine. You good on everything here, ma'am?

(Hmm... That's right. Everybody's still sending out greeting cards and gifts this year. I encouraged everybody to do Secret Santa, but...) You all get going. I still need to start on the popcorn balls.

What? Have you never had a popcorn ball before, Captain? Well now I've got to show you! C'mon over here. They're really easy once you get the hang of them. I tend to put different things in the center!
Ehehehehe... Thank you, Captain. Really, Eliezer was the one who helped me the most with all of it. I'm surprised we have so many ornaments here. I didn't think we'd find so many while in Europe.
There's been a lot of them coming in for the past couple days. It's about that time of year! Snowflake covered paradises, hot chocolate, warm hearths, ice fishing, gathering fresh birchwood...
We're certainly getting into the holiday spirit around here. What else are you making?
Oh, Captain! I have to show you my recipe for homemade eggnog. Please tell me you've had eggnog! Have you?
Then you haven't lived until you've tried mine. I swear to you, I've got the magic touch when it comes to that glorious nog. You'd better not be allergic to nuts now. There's a lot of nutmeg!
What!? Uff da! We have to change this, stat! Come with me, Captain! You aren't in the Christmas spirit until you've gotten a big 'ol glass of eggnog! It's not only tradition, but a staple!
If you're this worked up about it. It has to be good! All right, count me in!
Oh, by the way Captain. Have you gotten a gift for someone yet?
I have! You gave me that Secret Santa card, remember?
Ju~st checking. All right. C'mon! It's eggnog time!
(But I haven't given anybody a present... Isn't that the point of being a Secret Santa?)
Aboard the USS Minneapolis...
Hm. I think I'm getting better at these crosswords, Minnie.
Are you, now? I'll have you know I'm a real master at this kind of stuff.
Why's your board empty, then?
You watch it, you~
Actually, Captain, can I confide something in you?

Fields.MenuText: If it's about the eggnog, it was delicious.
It's about the yule log, isn't it?
Has someone been giving you trouble?

Fields.DialogueText: Why, thank you, Captain! I told you, it's much better to use a little bit of cinnamon and vanilla. It's that little sweetness that goes a long way. But that's not what I wanted to talk about.
It is not about the yule log. You did very nicely on that. I had to add a bit of chocolate shavings to the top, but other than that everything's fine. That's not what I'm asking...
My, my, Captain! I know I can always count on you to be at my side, even if I can handle things my own way. While thoughtful, it isn't what's on my mind.
What's on your mind, Minnie?
I was all for Secret Santa. Giving gifts is the best part of Christmas in my opinion! But... I have nobody to give a gift to myself.
Hm. That is a pickle and a half... I know you wouldn't feel right if you didn't have somebody to give something to.
I most certainly wouldn't! A gift given is a gift received. It's just not Christmas unless you can spread the holiday cheer around.
Everyone else who's on the ship is already participating. So... I wonder who you could give a gift to?
I wish I knew... (*Click!*) Oh, hello, Feng! Good to see you!
Afternoon, Minneapolis, Captain. Just came here to hand in my report for the day. Astoria's apparently finished writing that apology to Parizhskaya Kommuna you wanted.
Astoria? (Wait a minute, that's...!) Feng, do you know if she's busy?
What? Are you thinking of going to talk to her, Minneapolis? I don't think you'd like her. A friend of mine says she's kind of... overly self-assured.
Self-assured? What do you mean, Feng?
I heard she's the type to have diamonds on her fingers, an imported dress, and flaunts a brand new Ford. She's got a penchant for being extravagant.
My, my. She sounds like Pauline Sabin! Extravagant, you say? Uff da. How extravagant are we talking?
Extravagant? That woman can get anything she wants. You show her a six carat ring and she shows you twelve. You show her a rose, she hands you a bouquet. Stuff like that.
I see... Hm. Thank you for your report, Feng. Oh! Marcus and Eliezer were looking for you. They're setting up a... what did they call it? "Layabout"? "Lazy-kraut"?
Sounds a lot like "layout" to me. I'm not familiar with model trains, but it sounds like they want me to do decoration. I'll head right on down. Captain. Minneapolis.
Captain... I think I have an idea.
You're going to try and send a present to Astoria?
Does a beaver make dams?
Only when the Minneapolis Millers win.
Bahahahaha! Oh, now that's a good one, Captain.
Aboard the USS Minneapolis...
That may be the best Christmas present Astoria ever gives anyone.
Hm... No, that could use some more curvature. Let me... (*Clack, clack, clack!*) A little bit here... (*Clack, clack, clack!*) A little bit there... (*Clack, clack, clack!*) Hm...
Can I look yet?
Nope! Now, pass me the small chisel. I think what I've got going on is wonderful. It's a very delicate process what I've got going on here.
Right, chisel. (*Pop!*) By the way... I don't mean to pry, but...
Captain. You should know Minnesota Nice takes a lot of years to develop. Just tell me what's on your mind! I'm a big girl, I can take it.
You seemed even more determined to not only give, but make a gift when Feng said all that stuff about Astoria.
That I am. Feng, though he didn't do it intentionally, gave me some big ideas. And those ideas are... Oh! Uff da. That's going to be some detail later. A small brush, Captain, if you'd please?
Right here. (*Click!*) So, you were saying?
Well... When Feng said all of that stuff, it kinda reminded me of when we first started, Captain.
You mean back when I told you about what it meant to be from somebody else's point of view?
Exactly. As Feng said all of those things, I couldn't help but be... skeptical. I've never met the woman myself, nor have I heard about her before. But I don't think she's that bad as everyone says.
You can look at the door to a candy shop. But it's only when you go inside do you find out what's waiting. Sometimes, there might be more, or less than what you're hankering for.
But for this gal's money... I'd say I'd go into that store with nothing else in my mind other than: "I want to see what they've got!"
Minnie...
And that's why I was a bit reserved and annoyed after what Feng had said. Astoria might be proud of her feathers, but that doesn't make her a pompous swan! So... Yeah, that's why I'm doing this.

Fields.MenuText: I can't tell you how proud of you I am.
If she's a swan, you're a cardinal.
After all, you never really know someone...

Fields.DialogueText: ...until you walk a mile in their shoes! It's a sentiment I've become pretty familiar with. Though I can say I like my boots a lot, I wouldn't mind trying on some new ones... Eheheh~
Why... Captain! Y-You're going to make me flush like that! Cardinals are a thing of nature's bounty! I'm just a ship, a-and... Thank you...
Aw... Jeepers, Captain. You can't just pull that out of left field! That's cheating... Hmph! But... Thank you. Really, thank you. After all, you showed me a new point of view, too.
Even though I can't see what you're making, I can already tell it's going to be marvelous.
Oh it'll be done soon, Captain. Just keep those eyes closed a bit longer... (*Swish, swish, swish.*) Y'know, Joe said painting sometimes was a bit of a delicate, but chaotic process.
Sounds like something he'd say. What were you two talking about?
Well, he's worried about his folks back on the reservation. (*Swish, swish, swish!*) So I volunteered to send some of my cooking out to them. Should be there in about three days...
Now if that isn't the most Minneapolis thing ever!?
That isn't the most Minneapolis thing ever, Captain. This is.
Wha... Minnie... It's beautiful. How did you...?
Ah-bap-bap! Lookie, but no touchie! I spent a lot of time painting these parts and it still has yet to dry. But what do you think?
What do I think? I think this is something even Astoria can't buy. This is a one-of-a-kind Minne article. Look at these patterns... How did you do that?
I could teach you when we next woodcut. Right now... I think Astoria will love this lady. Let me tell you, those wings and roses were not easy to paint...
And the little shadows on the robe and snow, too. That must've been so hard! I'll make sure this gets put in something that says "HANDLE WITH CARE."
You'd better! You don't want to see 'nice' Minnie, do you?
Depends on which variation of nice that we're talking about.
All right, smartie. (*Pinch!*) C'mon. Let's get this wrapped, eat lunch, and then I'll write a card to go along with it.
Ouch. Sounds good to me! What are we having?
Honestly? I'm going to make a chicken noodle bake. I'm craving something filling today.
Aboard the USS Minneapolis...
Tell Warspite to proceed - the risk seems minimal. Just make sure they keep that Cowardice contained, and keep me in the loop.
Understood, Captain.
Minnie? Knock knock.
So I said: "If you're going to put that on the tree, at least put the whole thing on!" I mean, you might as well, right?
I can't really argue with that.
Right!? I get seeing things from the other side. But, have some decency! If you're going to have Santa's sleigh, you have to have all of the reindeer!
No, no I completely understand. It's like wanting to have pumpkin pie without whipped cream.
Eugh! Don't even *suggest* that, Captain! Who in their right mind wouldn't have whipped cream on a pumpkin pie!?
Nobody up to any good... Hm? Oh, hello, Joe. What do you have there?
Hau, Captain. Big sister. I've brought something especially for Minneapolis. It came just this afternoon.
That's the... fanciest wrapping on a crate I've ever seen.
Goodness! That bow... These latches! It looks more like a gigantic lockbox than a crate! Who's this from?
Astoria... Color me surprised, big sister. I didn't think she'd send something back! I'd... Hm? Oh. Looks like I'm needed in the Mess Hall. Please, tell me about it later! Big sister, Captain!
Astoria... sent this?
Let me... (*Click! Thunk! Thunk!*) Oh. It's like a case for an instrument! Wait, this can't be... actual onyx?
There's a card here, too! "For Miss Minneapolis," it says. Captain, would you mind if I read it?
If you're comfortable with me hearing it.
Oh for... You little smartie! (*Pat-pat!*) All right, let's see...
"Dear Miss Minneapolis."
"Christmas is often the loneliest time of the year for someone like me. There are a lot of parties, but no one to truly share in the festivities with. Glasses of champagne, bottles of wine..."
"Whether lobster, cornish hen, or even the finest lamb, there are no shortages of roasts. Desert, too. Therein the sweetest is often the last. But, the holiday season, though being last, is bitter."
"Time and time again, I've thought that perhaps I was different. That mayhaps Belles aren't supposed to enjoy such pleasures. Christmas is a paradox: to have everything, and have nothing."
"Then I was told that you, another Belle, had sent me something in the mail. You are the first one to have ever done so. When I opened the crate and beheld the visage of your masterwork..."

"Forgive me if it sounds childish, but I wept. I wept for perhaps hours. I couldn't believe that someone had not only sent me something, but that someone went farther than I could have ever imagined."
"This is the first Christmas in which I have felt not like a Belle out on the shivering sea, but as a woman. I truly felt the sweeter side that I often heard, but never tasted."
"This year... Christmas has felt like Christmas. And I couldn't be happier. I needed to find some way to repay you for showing me such compassion, and so I asked about..."
"I feel that what you'll find in here will suit you well. It is the least that I can give a woman of your caliber, craftsmanship, and passion. Please, take it and use it well. From my inner heart..."
"Thank you. Please, Miss Minneapolis. Have a very merry Christmas. - Your's respectfully, USS Astoria. Please, do keep in touch."
... I did not expect that at all. You did the right thing, Minnie. Above, and beyond.
Thank you, Captain. I... Willickers, I feel like my heart's going to flare up!
Well, don't burn that case, open it!
Right. Upsie! (*Click! Click!*) Well what have we... (*Gasp!*) B-By... Oh gosh. I can't believe it...
Woah. That has to be the finest logging axe I've ever seen... is that gold trim? And a bell?
It's... beautiful... It feels so warm in my hands, Captain.
You deserve it, Minnie. (*Pat-pat!*) Merry Christmas.
I-I! Aw gee... Heheheh... (*Sigh*) Hey, Captain. Is it all right if we just rest here for a bit?
Don't you want to go test out your new axe?
That can wait, Captain. Right now I'd just like to stay here and feel. Astoria's letter reminded me that Christmas is as much of a feeling as any... and I...
(Hug Minneapolis)
Uff! Da... Heheh... Captain... Thank you. Merry Christmas.
Merry Christmas, Minnie. I'll leave you to it.
Waiting for the results, sailor?
She bought it?
Yeah. Marcus did a great job with the "Christmas feels like Christmas" thing. I think it made the whole day for her.
No, just a card. Actually, I'm pretty sure it's even re-used - you can see she crossed out a "To Bobby."
*sigh*
That and the golden axe. Don't know where you found it, but great work under pressure.
Good. If anybody deserves a happy Christmas...
It's our girl. Agreed.
So, what did Astoria actually send?
You were right about Hood's connections. And her pet goldsmith.
Don't ask me how I knew.
Anyway, it paid off. She really is over the moon.
Merry Christmas, Captain.
Yeah. Merry Christmas to all.
Aboard the USS Minneapolis...
Aboard HMS Warspite...
It's good to keep our fine old traditions alive, isn't it?
Darling, you know I'm always happy to tell a good story. And *ghost* stories at Christmastime is the *finest* old tradition.
Wouldn't you agree?
... Da... net... navernoe... that is...
I don't really... celebrate Christmas. New Year's is more to my taste.
... And besides, it's pretty late in the year for... well... you know...
It's the first time that we've managed to get together in ages.
I never thought I'd say this, but God bless the Solidarity Fleet.
Jolly good. And besides, darling, you must have *so* many interesting ghost stories!
Well, I don't know about that... though something *did* happen aboard recently....
If it's all the same to you, I'd like to get started.
I wasn't able to get chestnuts roasting on an open fire... but I did bring these.
Oranges with cloves? And trifles? Oh, *darling*. You shouldn't have.
They certainly look tasty. Maybe I can make shortbread later.
Not a very Russian treat, is it?
Nyet. It's Scottish. But I thought you two might like it better...
Hey! I see you've got your little Christmas party started...
Ah! Captain! Of course, of course. Only the best for yours truly... and my friends, of course.
I trust all's well with the lumberjack girl?
It's not the worst joint operation I've ever commanded, and she's a pleasure to work with. 'Nuff said.
I'm on my way back, but first...

Fields.MenuText: I brought you girls a present...
I just wanted to see how you were doing.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh??? Which of my admirers sent me a gift this time?
Sorry to disappoint, but it's from Ark Royal.
Is there an implicit "compared to" in that "pleasure to work with," Captain?
Not at all. Though putting Astoria and Soviet Belles together is always... no. Never mind.
I'm sorry she couldn't make it. She's... very nice.
She also sent you a present.
That was really kind of her.
Splendidly, Captain. But what's that you're holding?
Oh, it's a present from Ark Royal.
Well... I'm not sure I'd say that.
It's pastry, yes? Did she send trifles? A Christmas cake?
... Um. Well. I guess you'll have to see for yourselves...
... She had... the absolute gall... to send us *fruitcake*?!
She said it was an interesting culinary challenge.
I shall have to send her a thank-you note. And a request not to do this again.
Well, I also got you three something for your party. Call it an apology.
Punch? Oh, Captain, you *do* know how to show a girl a good time.
I also brought a samovar. In case you'd rather have tea than punch.
Thank you, Kapitan. You took my advice?
Always happy to. Anyway.
I'll let you lovely ladies get back to your party.
Wotcher, Captain.
*ALARM*
Eugh. I was getting ready to tell my ghost story. Can't they leave us alone?
You'd think they'd at least be smart enough to avoid a group of this size.
They're rusalki. I don't think intelligence is the problem here.
Be that as it may. The faster we clean up this mess, the faster we can get back to our party.
@BATTLE
Aboard HMS Warspite...
Finally.
Let's not dwell on it. The punch is still warm, the tea has steeped, and the treats are... good enough.
And we've got ghost stories to tell. Isn't that right?
Tipa tovo...
I'll go first? If it's all the same to you.
It's not, but I assumed you'd take the lead. Have at it.
Hours in the future, but not many...
And then I rushed in, guns blazing, my hair absolutely *perfect*--
(...I thought we were meant to tell *scary* stories...)
(Her narcissism isn't frightening enough for you?)
(We let her talk long enough, she'll get a sore throat, then we can get on with it.)
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!!!!
-- What the hell was that?
Language, Hood. But I suppose we ought to go see.
Did it sound like a rusalka to you? We should be careful.
Psh. If it's just one Morgana, we can take care of it easily.
If you say so...
And so, our heroines investigate...
What on earth...
A single Cowardice.
... Chasing her own tail.
She looks badly damaged. No guns... no missiles... dodgy engines... fire damage...
Let's put her out of her misery, da?
Wait. I have a better idea.
AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA!
I'M DOOMED! I'M DOOMED! THIS IS THE END!
She interrupted my story, she's screaming like a banshee, *and* she's going to keep being a bloody nuisance.
I say we have some fun with her.
What do you propose?
It's a Cowardice, right? ...I think she'd *enjoy* our little competition.
Competition?
We bring her aboard-
Easier said than done.
-- And we make her play the game. If she tells a scary enough story, we let her go.
... On the one hand, this seems unnecessarily dangerous...
And on the other?
It could be useful information.
Exactly! We could find out some things about Morganas. And if we don't, we'd get a lark out of it.
I don't know.
Ah, where's your sense of humour?
... I just wanted to spend time with my old comrades. Not... whatever this is.
Let's give it a go? For the intel, if nothing else?
Chemú byt', togó ne minovát'...
She's taking more hits than I thought she could! We're going to have to pull her off her deck!
No no no please no! Mistrust, please don't-- I don't want to--
Mistrust?
W-wait- you're *BELLES*?!
Some time later...
So the rusalki see *us* as... rusalki?
She could have made a mistake. Fog of war and all that.
Mm. Your hair *is* a little choppy.
And yours is a little... unusual.
Choppy isn't a bad thing. It... honestly, it suits you.
... Ah. I see.
Girls, girls. You're both pretty. And we caught her! Isn't that right, Cowardice?
......wehhhhhhhhhhh..........
Do you know why you're here?
Y-y-you're gonna torture me, and then you're gonna kill me, and you're gonna roast me over a slow fire, and--
Nyet, nyet. Nothing like that. *Right, Hood?*
She *did* interrupt me. Hanging is too good for her.
Focus.
Cowardice, you're here because we have a challenge for you.
A-- a challenge?? That sounds. Hard. And scary. I... I don't think I want a challenge.
Well, we're giving you one. It's Christmas, isn't it?
Is... is it?
-- One of our Christmas traditions is telling ghost stories. So.
We're going to make you a *deal*.
... oh no...
*If* you can tell us a scary story... any kind of scary story... we'll let you go.
A-and when I can't???
Then we'll *sink* you.
Nnnnnnnnn--
We *will* let you go, if you can do this. I swear on... on my own grave.
... You died?
A long time ago. Doesn't matter.
The point is, we want you to tell a scary story! So come on! Spill your guts!
... She just grabbed her stomach...
Uh- uh- uh- w- um-
Well? It's your story or your life.
I- I- I- okay, okay! I'll do anything you want, just don't kill me!!!!!!
Um- um- um--
S-so- I - I got kidnapped by a bunch of crazy Belles... and then... and then...
O-one of them told me... she was a ghost!!!
Ugh, don't be *ridiculous*, darling.
If you're going to tell a scary story, you have to know your audience. You have to know what scares them.
G-ghosts are scary- right?
Yes. But none of us are scared of Bezbozhnik. She's... a friend.
My friends call me something else.
Oh?
I'll tell you later. Thank you, by the way.
Don't mention it.
S-so you're gonna kill me?
Mmmm... I think you can do better. Try again.
Uh- uh- uhhhhhhh-
W-well- there was - there was that time with Infestation--
Go on.
About ninety seconds later...
--and then she laid a bunch of eggs down his throat, and his guts sprayed all over the deck, and the crew *screamed*!
Well. That was... fascinating.
(Are you all right? You're turning green...)
(Yes, fine. I just need my cat.)
That... that wasn't... *scary*. It was just disgusting.
Nn- nn- b-but--
Y-you were scared! I saw you! You look like you're going to throw up--
A-and she's all clammy! The only one of you who isn't scared is the ghost--
One more time, slattern.
Hood! There's no need for that kind of language.
She *interrupted* me. She deserves anything we can dish out.
(What would the Captain say at a time like this?)

Fields.MenuText: We're supposed to be *celebrating*. Not... whatever this is.
Torture's a filthy practice. Don't let us start.

Fields.DialogueText: ... She's right. We've gotten sidetracked.
This isn't torture! It's just--
Uh--
She's been down for the past two hours and you're still twisting the knife.
This might be the last chance we get to spend any time with our friends...
With Bezbozhnik.
If we're going to put her out of everyone's misery, we should do it quickly and efficiently.
Thank you.
...We really shouldn't waste it on your petty grudge, Hood.
Not... not like this. You're *playing* with her.
If this is how you do Christmas, I want no part in it.
*pop*
Wait, Bez- where did you go?
Ugh. So melodramatic.
Honestly, darling, why did you even invite her? She's such an *awful* bore.
... We knew each other before we woke up.
Wait- 'Spite, where are you going?
To find my friend. See you, Hood.
So... does this mean I get to go now?
Shut *up*.
Could today get any more trying? I swear, it's like everyone but me has forgotten what Christmas is all about.
Pardon me, ma'am. You wouldn't happen to have a spare axe handy, would you? Or a goldsmith? Asking on behalf of the Captain.
My life is farce.
Aboard HMS Warspite...
Aboard HMS Warspite...
Bezbozhnik?
[No reply, but the Carol of the Bells played on violin]
Ah. I found you at last.
L55? Ellie?
... Warspite. I'm sorry for my outburst.
Don't be. I think you told Hood what we were all thinking.
... Spasibo. That's... appreciated.
Any time.
It's funny... you don't celebrate Christmas, do you?
Nyet. Not since I... crossed over.
You know the story of the Christmas Truce, don't you?
I've heard it, yes. Why bring it up now?
... I think you understand the spirit of Christmas better than either Hood or I do.
Ha. It's just mercenary.
How do you mean?
If your leaders decide to fight a counter-revolution... and I hope it never comes to that...
... I would want you to treat me with more mercy than we treated Cowardice. And vice versa.
Of course we would.
There's no "of course" about it from where I'm standing. But thank you.
... I heard some of the other girls are going to be here soon. Bulldog, Achilles, maybe Renown. We can have a proper party.
Renown and Hood in the same room? I think they'd sink whatever poor soul they board...
Well, maybe you can help me keep them apart.
As long as we stay together?
Do let's.
Moments in the future, but not many...
... and all the men on the deck positively *swooned*, darling!
Uh- Uh-huh, uh-huh. That's --
That's really cool and interesting (please don't kill me)!
Ah. You still have your captive audience?
She's positively enthralled, darling.
Y-yes, yes, I am! Yes! Absolutely stunned and bedazzled.
Well. I think we're done here.
She told a scary story. We're scared. It doesn't make any sense to drag this out any longer.
W-wait!
J-just to be sure. That I kept up my end. Of the deal.
I want t-to tell one more s-story. Just one. And then. You *can't* go back on it. If it's scary enough.
No t-traps! No tricks.
Well... all right. I guess we can listen to *one* more scary story.
... All right... uhhhh. So....
It was a dark and stormy night... uhhhh...
Moments in the future, but not many...
That was better than it had any right to be.
Thanks. Soooo... um.... I can go now, right?
... I can't believe I'm saying this, but... yes. You did what you said you'd do. And it *is* Christmas.
*BOOM*
Ohhh, it looks like you ratted us out--
I- I had nothing to do with this! I swear!!
No time for regrets. Let's roll up our sleeves and get to it.
@BATTLE
Well? What are you waiting for? You can go.
... Why were you nice to me?
Ah?
They were going to k-k-kill me.
In their defence, captive rusalki - your sisters - don't generally give us much of a choice in the end.
... But I guess my heart's too soft. Especially for ghosts.
I- I'm not a ghost!
I don't know what else to call you. We sink you and sink you, and you come back every time. And every time you seem to come back a little more... wrong.
... I mean, when you put it that way... It doesn't really matter.
Before I go.
Hm?
You... you do music and stuff, right? You're the one who likes to fiddle on the deck.
... Yes. And?
Iiiiiii found something in a port. Uh. I didn't know what to do with it. But.
It's your stupid present holiday and you were nice to me and I can't really use it.
*POP*
Here you go.
Ai ai ai. Is this... a *Stradivarius*?
A straddi- I dunno. It was shiny, but it's not metal. I can't use it.
I.... this is an incredibly sweet gift. Thank you.
... You really ought to go. But...
B-but?
... You're a better storyteller than you are a soldier.
O-oh.
I'm not going to tell you what to do about that. But I thought you should know.
Wwwellllllllllll... maybe... Vanity said something about a charm offensive....
What?
Nothing! Nothing! I didn't say that you didn't hear that you didn't-
Tssssss. Tssss. I heard nothing.
